ygData.subject: [Announcement] First release of NutchWAX + WERA access tool
ygData.msgSnippet: We would like to announce the release of NutchWAX -- the Nutch search engine + extensions for searching web archive collections -- and WERA, a web archive

From: stack <stack@...>
Subject: [Announcement] First release of NutchWAX + WERA access tool
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281; y=oGVhan5WLwNs9246vvhTzH0sCgOgni7LnB4M63kF5d31M_AwPHNSvAaR
X-Yahoo-Profile: stackarchiveorg

We would like to announce the release of NutchWAX -- the Nutch search 
engine + extensions for searching web archive collections -- and WERA, a 
web archive collection viewer application from the NWA Toolset that has 
been adapted to use NutchWAX.  The two tools used in concert provide 
full-text search of small web archive collections and an Internet 
Archive Wayback-like means of browsing archive collection resources 
across time.

NutchWAX is hosted at sourceforge: 
http://archive-access.sourceforge.net/projects/nutch/.  Instructions on 
how to obtain and setup NutchWAX and WERA can be found at the NutchWAX 
site.  This site also has pointers to the sourceforge mailing list to 
use discussing the NutchWAX+WERA tools and issue tracking databases for 
bugs and enhancement requests.  All commentary and feedback is welcomed.

Both NutchWAX and WERA should be considered alpha-grade software (See 
the Bug and RFE list for a listing of known issues).

(Check the NutchWAX site next week for a pointer to a demonstration of 
WERA+NutchWAX working together.)

Yours,
Sverre Bang and Michael Stack
